task_goal: Open the settings menu and navigate to display options.
gemini_output:
The screenshot displays a typical Android home screen.  At the top is the status bar showing the time (05:31), notification icons, and system icons. Below the status bar, a Google search bar is partially visible. The main area of the screen shows app icons arranged in a grid.  Visible app icons and labels include YouTube, Settings, Photos, Clock, Calendar, Camera, Chrome, Contacts, Drive, Files, Gmail, Google, Maps, Messages, Phone, T-Mobile, and YT Music.  "All apps" text is visible, indicating the user is on the main app drawer screen.  A navigation bar is present at the bottom edge of the screen.


To achieve the goal "Open the settings menu and navigate to display options":

1. **Tap the "Settings" icon.**  There are two instances of the Settings icon (a gear in a blue circle) visible on the screen. Either can be used.
2. **Locate and tap "Display".** This step assumes a standard Android settings menu structure. The exact text and location might vary slightly between devices and Android versions, but "Display" is a common label for screen settings.  Scrolling may be required to locate the "Display" option within the Settings menu.
